reviewText: This is not a very comprehensive survey of the historicity (or lack thereof) of the biblical narrative Exodus.  This is mainly about the Red Sea Crossing.  Even by that standard it is not comprehensive and focuses only a single proposed route for the crossing with only a passing mention of other theories.OK, so it has a narrow scope.  I might deduct one or two stars for that.However, what about the material it does present?  Well, I found that to be lacking as well.  The best 'evidence' offer is to look at coral formations and interpret their shapes as parts of chariots.  I thought that was a bit a stretch and lacking in scientific rigor, but okay, that's their idea.  Is there any more value they could extract from that theory?  I think there is: the supposed chariot axle must have some physical dimensions that could be measured.  The metal detector idea was good but we only got a very vague discussion of that.  Another thing that would have been helpful is a sort of diagram of where the coral formations are relative to the big sandy path.  Generally, the video did a good job of using maps to illustrate its points, but we seemed to get no such detail for the specific area of the crossing.I was also disappointment that no paleogeography was brought to bear on the topic.  I know it wasn't *that* long ago, but 3000 years isn't trivial either, and it's know that there is a significant rift zone there.  So, when the narrator dismisses one of the potential crossing sites as having been too steep and too deep for people to have crossed, it seems to me that a rift would imply that it wasn't always that deep and so I'd be reluctant to eliminate possibilities based only on modern day topography.  But the real point is just that it would have been nice to have had this topic addressed by the documentary.  The video touts its use of 'science' but besides the seemingly non-rigorous investigation of the coral, there wasn't much other science.So, because even the material that is presented is a bit weak, I had to deduct another star.  Still, it is a fascinating topic and adds some ideas to the discussion worth more investigation.

Scripture over and over says that Mt. Sinai is in the land of Midian, it is "out  of Egypt" and according to the Bible in Galatians 4:25, even says that Mt. SInai is in Arabia.Yes, the real Mt. Sinai is in Saudi Arabia where is it known as Jabal Musu, Jabal al-Lawz, or Moses' Mountain.  This is where Moses tended the flocks of Jethro his father-in-law, in the land of MIdian which is NOT in the Egyptian Sinai Peninsula but in the land of current Saudi Arabia, east of the Gulf of Aquba.  In the Bible, see Exodus 2:15-16, 22; 3:1,10-12; 4:18-21.  Even Elijah went here in 1 Kings 19:8 and stayed in the cave on the mountain (Mt. Horeb- see Exodus 3:1) when he was "running" from Queen Jezebel.This video shows the burnt black top of the mountain, the V-shaped burnt altar site at the base of the mountain where they offered burnt offerings up to God, boundary markers around the mountain, the split rock where the water gushed out to water the children of Israel, the twelve springs of Elim along with the 70 palms, the golden calf altar, etc..  There is no other site on earth that fits all of the descriptions of the Bible and you can see it with your own eyes.This was first found by Ron Wyatt while he was searching for Mt. Sinai, and he made the map that the men on this video followed tofind it and record the proof.Another video that is as equally important and should be purchased is called "The Search for the Real Mt. Sinai."

reviewText: The DVD "The Exodus Revealed: Searching for the Red Sea Crossing" is a compelling documentary which offers conclusive evidence that a Biblical exodus actually took place when the million of Israelites led by Moses came out of the bondage of Egypt and crossed over the Red Sea to worship God in Mount Sinai. Dr. Lennart Moller, a scientist in medicine and molecular biology, is one of the experts leading the quest to search for the evidence of existence of Israel in ancient Egypt; discovery of Red Sea crossing site; and the actual location of Real Mount Sinai.The documentary provides enough archaeological evidence to suggest that a significant Canaanite population once inhabited the biblical land of Goshen in ancient north eastern Egypt.  The documentary unveils some of the excavated ruins and remains of the earliest Israelite settlements found in Egypt. The documentary then questions the possibility of Mount Sinai to be located in the traditional Sinai Peninsula, arguing that there has not been any conclusive evidence in the area. In fact, the scriptures indicate in Exodus chapter 2 that Moses had fled before 40 years of Exodus to the land of Midian located now what is today Saudi Arabia. It would have been an ideal place for Moses fleeing from incarceration to take refuge there as opposed to Sinai Peninsula which was then under the control of Egypt. It was in Midian where Moses married a midianite woman and lived in obscurity at his father-in-law's home until the day he wandered at the base of Mount Sinai. So, the real Mount Sinai has to be in Arabia. The Bible also places Mount Sinai in Arabia in Galatians 4:25. Even Josephus records that the Mount Sinai was the highest mountain in the city of Midian.After establishing that the Mount Sinai must be located in Arabia, the documentary singles out Jebel el Lawz in Saudi Arabia as the mountain fitting the biblical description of Mount Sinai. It is the highest peak in the entire North Western Saudi Arabian region. It has a jagged blackened peak as if scorched by fire matching with the fact that the Lord had descended upon it in fire as recorded in scriptures. It has a man-made altar at the base of the mountain with the Egyptian-style petroglyphs of cows and bulls, proving that it is the infamous golden calf altar made by the Israelites in the absence of Moses. There is also a large rock in the area similar to Rock at Horeb described in Exodus from which Moses drew water after striking it with his rod. This rock is split through the middle and displays the pattern of water erosion and evidence that numerous streams came forth in several directions.The documentary then proposes that if Mount Sinai is in Arabia, there must lie in between it and Egypt a body of water outside the boundary of Egyptian territory which the Israelites crossed over. The documentary identifies it as the Gulf of Aqaba, the right arm of the Red Sea, which also fits with the biblical description. The Gulf of Aqaba is extremely deep, plunging more then one mile deep in some areas and is adjacent to a dense wilderness in rugged mountains. Surrounded with mountains, the beach at Nuweiba on the Gulf of Aqaba is the only potential site in the area that could have easily accommodated the vast multitude of Israelites, their flocks, and also pharaoh's army. The documentary then goes on to reveal some of the chariot remains discovered in the sea bed of the Gulf which were covered in coral, making it difficult to see them clearly, though it appears that the coral was the agent the Lord used to preserve them. But what is incredible is the discovery of a underwater land bridge from Nuweiba beach across to the Saudi shore, which is much shallower than the sea on either side of the bridge. This exciting information shows a consistent pathway across the gulf to the other shore that, with the water removed, could have easily been traveled by Israelites.These new discoveries in the documentary establish scientifically that the biblical exodus happened exactly as recorded in the Bible. However, I must also point out that the Red Sea crossing site and the Real Mount Sinai were first discovered by amateur biblical archeologist Mr.Ron Wyatt who is also credited with the discovery of Noah's Ark. It was he who first entered Saudi Arabia along with his two sons without proper papers and went on to discover the site. In fact, Dr. Lennart Moller, in his outstanding book "The Exodus Case: New Discoveries Confirm the Historical Exodus" has mentioned that the person who made these discoveries was Ron Wyatt after a 40 years' extensive research and having made more than 100 trips to the Middle East. When Dr. Lennart Moller  and Ron Wyatt were brought together on a common platform, it was decided that Dr. Lennart Moller would evaluate the discoveries made by Ron. Together, they made several trips to the Middle East before all these things were put in the book. I strongly recommend the said book "The Exodus Case: New Discoveries Confirm the Historical Exodus" which is available at Amazon (ISBN-10: 8772472308, ISBN-13: 978-8772472300) for a much wider and detailed analysis on Exodus.If you want to have more information on various other evidences found at Mount Sinai & the Red Sea crossing site, I strongly recommend that you go to the website of Wyatt Musuem (just search it on any search engine like yahoo or google. Not being able to mention it due to restrictions) to purchase "Exodus" DVD to get more detailed footage of the sites. The "Exodus" DVD available there presents some more compelling evidences like the altar "Jehovah Nissi" made by Moses near the Rock at Horeb, the remains of 12 Marble Pillars erected by Moses for the twelve tribes of Israel as recorded in the Scriptures, a Solitary tree located at the peak of Mt. Sinai, the area of the Holy Precinct and Phoenician-style granite column erected later by King Solomon on either shore of Gulf of Aqaba to commemorate the great event of Exodus.The above site also contains DVDs on discoveries of Noah's Ark, Sodom & Gomorrah and Ark of the Covenant. After viewing these DVDs, I really believe that the God had chosen Ron Wyatt to unearth all the major discoveries to be a witness for this last adulterous generation, as all the discoveries made by Mr.Ron Wyatt are incredible and possible only with the understanding given by the LORD. I feel privileged and blessed to have witnessed the proof of God's mighty work in the past and also invite you to share the evidence put forth by God.
summary: That day the LORD saved Israel from the hands of the Egyptians!!!

reviewText: I like to be able to back up my statements with sound evidence, rather than emotional "faith statements", and resources like this make it possible.This video is an excellent tool, both for arguing ... um, debating :-) college theology professors and liberals who like to say the Bible is "a collection of myths and legends that must be taken in context and interpreted for our day", and is "not to be taken literally". OKAY. What about this video? Seems literal to me.The footage is better quality than the (also highly recommended) video "Exodus" - featuring the research and discoveries of Ron Wyatt; written and narrated by Mary Nell Wyatt. Spring Hill, Tenn. : Wyatt Archaeological Research, c1998.Mr. Wyatt's includes the WHOLE Exodus journey, including even more astonishing images than this video by Questar...such as of the grain storage pits in a certain Egyptian city, used in Joseph's administration!Anyway, this video moves along with good narration and visual quality. There is no doubt that what they are describing is what is being shown on screen.There is underwater footage from a remote mini sub that examined the chariot remains, which could not be sampled for study due to conservation rules against disturbing the coral, although it is an archaeological site.The probable route of Moses with Israel is traced out from Goshen through mid Sinai Peninsula, then south along the "wilderness route", through an 18-mile canyon called Wadi Watir (sp?) which opens onto Nuevo Beach. You have to see the canyon to believe it. There is really NO escape except to go into the water, because the mountains are so rugged.The Gulf of Aquaba is about a mile deep in most places, but conveniently at this location, only 900 feet! They skip mentioning that marker pillars used to be on both sides of the crossing. This was noted and filmed in Wyatt's video. However the Arabs are notable touchy about the idea, and removed theirs, as they have also made Jebel al Laws (sp?) off limits to visitors. As in barbed wire, guard outpost, and helicopters.The mountain of God is located in Arabia, just as the Bible describes. Despite Arab bans on visitors, it can be seen from satellite, and there is a plain big enough for the Israelites to have camped in, with a second smaller one adjacent, and which would have accommodated the "mixed multitude" that came with them.The burned mountain top is shown from the ground at a distance. Climbing it is unwise - being overflown by Saudi airforce from time to time...Omitted here, but present in Wyatt's video: The water erosion from both the split rock and Sinal, and the 12 wells for the 12 tribes at the campsite. There were also petroglyphs of bulls and cattle on some of the rocks, which did get shown here.It was good to note that the probable pharaoh was not Rameses, but an 18th dynasty king. This is based on the chariot wheels being of 3 different styles, which only happened at that time.For more....watch the video. It bears rewatching and reflection, because there is so much detail, and so much we have not been taught in "history class" or "sunday school".
summary: Better images than the Wyatts' Exodus video of '98

reviewText: I never thought I'd find compelling the argument that Mt Sinai was in Saudi Arabia.  While I still don't believe it, and it isn't the main focus of the video, the producers and director didn't make the whole "Sinai in Arabia" scenario look completely ridiculous.Most of the time in this video is spent trying to establish the proposition that the Parting of the Sea during the Exodus took place across a very deeply submerged sand spit which sort of crosses the Gulf of Aqaba.  The sand was deposited by erosion brought on by centuries of flash floods triggered by rains falling over hundreds of square miles of the Sinai and issuing out of a wadi.  What that means (even assuming a Miocene age for the Great Rift, and I don't) is that whatever the level was 3500 years ago, the sand must be even deeper now.  The sand spit would have been under even more water then, and anything on or near the surface of the sand must be much more recent.There's just no evidence for the Exodus having taken place at the Gulf of Aqaba.  The time frame isn't consistent with the only literary source for the story -- the Book of Exodus -- and I have to conclude that the only reason it was dreamed up in the first place was to make the Sinai-in-Arabia idea more plausible.One problem that generally crops up in these videos (and in many books) is that the Exodus is chronologically placed during the New Kingdom.  The bright spot is that the various talking heads in this program place Joseph in the Middle Kingdom and date the Exodus to circa 1450 BC.  For the latter they get a bravo.Lennart Moller, author of "The Exodus Case: New Discoveries Confirm the Historical Exodus", appears here and there throughout, and while he subscribes to the view that the Parting of the Sea took place at Aqaba, and takes a dive (so to speak) to look at the coral formations (and modern piece of brasswork) which are often claimed to be remains of chariot wheels from the pharaoh's army, his contribution is very positive.This is a decent video.  It has a broadcast version (which I didn't watch), a director's cut which is about 30 minutes longer (if memory serves), and about five short overview segments pertaining to different aspects of the Exodus.

reviewText: All I can say is, this quite the Biblical DocumentaryFirst, there is the discovery of Hebrews settlements in Egypt and ancient Documents listin the trading of Slaves amongst Egyptian Royals, with over half of the names listed being "characteristically Hebrew". Also, there is the discovery of Hebrews suddenly appearing in Palestine several centuries later, with statues of Canaanite Gods smashed and decapitated.Now knowing that there was once a large Hebrew slave population in Egypt that had a large migration to Palestine several centuries later, the primary challenge is the location of the actual Mount Sinai and the Actual Red Sea. Most previous searches have yielded next to nothing in the way of actual evidence, with no direct evidence to authenticate an actual Mt. Sinai, and all of the proposed Red Seas being far too shallow to necessitiate the waters being parted.However, in Saudi Arabia, on Mountain is blackened at the top, as is scorched by fire, matching the Exodus verse "and the Lord descended on it in fire." The is also an enormous platuea that could easily serve as a camping ground, and large, flat pile of rocks with crude sketces of bulls on them, that could have served as an altar for the golden cow, and , to top it all off, and sixty foot tall rock, split right down the center, with evidence of water erosion at it's base (and this in an area that, we learn in DVD special features, gets about 2 inches of rain per year. This could be the rock  Moses split to provide Water for the Hebrews.But for all this to be authentic to the Exodus, the Hebrews must first cross a body of water. The Gulf of Aqaba, which separates the Sinai peninsula from Saudi Arabia, could very well be just the place. There is an enormous beach on the Sinai Peninsula, called the Nueva Peninsula, with mountains on all sides, matching the Biblical descripition of the beach (Pi Hahiroth, Hebrew for mouth of the gorges). Also, while most of the Gulf of Aqaba is over a mile deep, and steeping with jagged corals, making it nearly impossible to walk over even without the water, there is a flat, extremely wide, sand covered ridge extending to the Saudi coast (but still deep enough to necessitate the removal of the water.) And finally, there is the discover of dozens and dozens of coral and silt covered circular structures, resembling Egyptian chariot wheels (scientists have even found traces of metal inside them.)With all of this evidence put together, you can't help but wonder whether the Red Sea was really parted on that day . I highly recommend this excellent Documentary (particularly the Director's Cut), as well as JESUS AND THE SHROUD OF TURIN.And the Lord opened the sea for them, and the Hebrews walked through, with a wall of water on their right and on their left.That Day, the Lord Saved Israel.Exodus 14:29
summary: Probably the First Documentary to have a Director's Cut!!!

reviewText: This is a documentary produced by Christian scholars, so obviously it has the agenda to prove that the Bible is literally true.  Nevertheless, it does attempt to present the evidence in a non-biased manner and does a pretty good job of it.  Using the Bible itself, ancient documents and historical accounts from outside the Bible, plus modern satellite imagery, the DVD presents the theory that Mt. Sinai was in the Arabian desert, not the Sinai peninsula as was traditionally believed. The same theory was previously presented in a book calledThe Mount Sinai Myth (formerly The Mountain of Moses)by Larry Williams, which describes a clandestine journey to the location in Arabia that might have been the Mountain of God.  (The Arabian authorities do not permit archaeological digs or exploration there, and the area itself is fenced off and forbidden to trespassers.)  Williams' book is currently out of print but worth reading if you can track down a copy.  The photos of the blackened mountain and the possible calf altar in the DVD appear to have been taken from this book.As pointed out by another reviewer here (but not mentioned in the video), there have been accusations that the coral-encrusted "chariot wheels" found at the theoretical crossing point in the Gulf of Aqaba are fakes, planted there by one Ron Wyatt. Maybe.  But then again, coral grows at a very slow rate, so how did these supposed fakes get encrusted so quickly if they were dumped there in the 20th century?  Unknown.  But even without the chariot wheels, the proposed route makes sense according to the various ancient accounts.  In the satellite photos, you can clearly see the trade route snaking through the mountains and across the desert.  The wide plain at the foot of the Arabian mountain also fits the biblical description of a place where thousands camped.The extra features on the DVD were good also, although without much depth.  My guess is that they were intended as short introductions for use in Bible classes (and they would work well for that purpose).  The most interesting one to me was "Cecil B. DeMille's Exodus," which, although it is not stated on the DVD, is actually the original 1956 "making of" trailer for "The Ten Commandments."  It consists of a 10-minute presentation by DeMille himself, where you get to see some of the props from the movie, view a few clips, and hear his sincere respect for the Exodus story.  DeMille also talks about some of the historical records he used in his research, and explains the infamous blooper about Moses supposedly having "horns" -- based on a mistranslation of the Hebrew word "keren," which also means "beams of light."  Thank you, Mr. DeMille, for setting the record straight! (If the background of this movie interests you further, I recommendThe Ten Commandments (50th Anniversary Collection)DVD set, which has an excellent audio commentary, andAmerica's Prophet: Moses and the American Storyby Bruce Feiler, which devotes a whole chapter to DeMille's movie and its influence on American culture.)
summary: Interesting achaeology seems to support the Torah account

reviewText: I have long held the belief that since God is the author of ALL truth, authentic scientific truth CANNOT conflict with authentic interpretation of the Bible or theology.  If they APPEAR to conflict, then we've either gotten the science wrong or we have a faulty understanding of the theology.The scientific community has long held that Exodus was "just a story" because no hard archeological evidence had been found--until now.  The recent uncovering of hard archeological evidence supporting the Exodus account is but one vindication of the belief encompassed by my opening statement.The authors of this documentary demonstrate a firm basis in the scientific method.  They start with remains in what was the Biblical land of Goshen which have proven to be evidence of Isrealite settlements, dating possibly as far back as the approximate time of the Genesis account of Joseph.  They then follow the evidence of the Exodus all the way through to a proposed location of Mt. Sinai.Of course, the probable location of the Red Sea crossing and pretty provocative evidence of chariots littering the seabed in this area feature prominently, as the documentary's name implies.I loved this documentary.  The information is presented in a scientifically sound and very entertaining manner.  I feel that this DVD adds to both my Faith and my understanding of science.  I strongly recommend it without reservation.
summary: Faith and Science, working together to help build a better understanding of reality

reviewText: I've been a very firm, studious believer and teacher of the inspired Holy Scriptures for nearly forty years now. If the speculation on this DVD is true (Israelites crossed the Red Sea on the east side of the Sinai Peninsula, the Aqaba, and into the land of Midian) then they would have to relocate quite a list of other cities. First find ANY map of the Israelite's Trek. The scriptures clearly state that AFTER the Israelites went through the Red Sea (not before) they camped at (1) The Wilderness of Shur, (2) Marah (Exodus 15:22), (3) Elim (v27), (4) The Wilderness of Sin (Exodus 16:1) and (5) Rephidim (Exodus 17:1). All of these areas are on the WEST side of the Sinai Peninsula, and thus located WEST of the Aqaba. (Exodus 15:22,27) If the Israelites crossed the Red Sea where this DVD claims then all of these cities and deserts would need to be situated EAST of there (the Aqaba), but they aren't. Furthermore, once the Israelites left Sinai, they had food problems in Kibroth-hattaavah and nearby Hazeroth, once again located WEST of the Aqaba, indicating the Israelites must have magically popped back over to the "traditional" Mt Sinai on the Sinai Peninsula. (Numbers 10:33, 11:34,35) Look at ANY AND ALL BIBLICALLY BASED maps outlining the travels of Moses and the Israelites. Nearly all of their wanderings were within or just above the Sinai Peninsula (not east of the Aqaba, as this documentary shamefully aledges).Midianites were nomads so it wouldn't be surprising for them to be in the Sinai Peninsula area. At this same time, they were even twice the distance of the traditional Mt. Sinai; up north in the Moabite territory (Salt Sea, Jordan River area). Numbers 22:1-4Unfortunately, this kind of programming either (1) attempts to show errors in the Bible or (2) displays the gullibility in those quick to believe the misleading "proofs" these programs fabricate. Likewise (3) it gives rise to ridiculars of the Bible and (4) causes doubt in the credibility of these kinds TV programs put on by the Discovery Channel and others (if they mess up so bad here, what else do they get so obviously wrong).
